title: Introduction to Information Technology
description: Explores fundamental concepts of computers, IT, databases, networking, internet, multimedia, and cybersecurity.

title: C Programming
description: Covers structured programming concepts, including problem-solving, control structures, arrays, pointers, and file handling.

title: Digital Logic
description: Introduces digital logic concepts, including Boolean algebra, circuit design, sequential logic, and digital devices.

title: Mathematics I
description: Covers functions, limits, derivatives, integrals, differential equations, vectors, partial derivatives, and multiple integration.

title: Physics
description: Explores rotational dynamics, oscillations, electromagnetism, quantum mechanics, solid-state physics, semiconductors, and integrated circuits.

title: Discrete Structure
description: Covers logic, proofs, sets, relations, counting, probability, and their applications in computer science.

title: Object Oriented Programming
description: Covers fundamental concepts of object-oriented programming using C++.

title: Microprocessor
description: Covers fundamentals of computer organization, I/O interfaces, and interrupt operations.

title: Mathematics II
description: Focuses on linear algebra concepts, including systems of equations, determinants, vector spaces, eigenvalues, and matrix decomposition.

title: Statistics I
description: Covers descriptive statistics, probability, sampling, random variables, distributions, correlation, and regression.

title: Data Structure and Algorithm
description: Covers fundamental data structures (stack, queue, list, tree, graph) and algorithms for sorting, searching, and recursion.

title: Numerical Method
description: Focuses on numerical techniques for solving nonlinear equations, interpolation, regression, differentiation, integration, and partial differential equations.

title: Computer Architecture
description: Covers instruction set architecture, micro-architecture, and system architecture, focusing on data representation, CPU organization, and memory systems.

title: Computer Graphics
description: Covers graphics hardware, software, geometric transformations, rendering techniques, and virtual reality concepts.

title: Statistics II
description: Covers descriptive statistics, probability, sampling, random variables, correlation, regression, and hypothesis testing.

title: Theory of Computation
description: Study of finite automata, regular expressions, grammars, Turing machines, and computational complexity.

title: Computer Networks
description: Introduces computer networking concepts and discusses the layers of networking models.

title: Database Management System
description: Covers database concepts, system architecture, data modeling, relational models, SQL, normalization, transaction processing, and database recovery.

title: Operating Systems
description: Introduces operating system concepts, including process management, memory management, file systems, I/O management, and Linux case study.

title: Artificial Intelligence
description: Introduces AI principles, including intelligent agents, problem solving, search algorithms, knowledge representation, machine learning, and natural language processing.

title: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
description: Learn fundamental techniques for algorithm design and analysis, including divide and conquer, greedy methods, dynamic programming, graph algorithms, NP-completeness, and approximation strategies.

title: System Analysis and Design
description: Explore systems development, planning, analysis, design, implementation, and maintenance, along with object-oriented development and project management techniques.

title: Cryptography
description: A comprehensive study of cryptosystems covering traditional and modern ciphers, hash functions, authentication, network security protocols, and malicious logic.

title: Simulation and Modelling
description: Explore system modeling, simulation techniques, queuing theory, random number generation, and simulation languages.

title: Web Technology
description: Explore the fundamentals of web development, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, XML, PHP, and modern frameworks.

title: Multimedia Computing
description: Learn the core concepts of multimedia systems, including audio, video, graphics, data compression, and application design.

title: Society and Ethics in Information Technology
description: Explore sociological concepts and ethical challenges in IT, including intellectual property, computing's social context, and emerging ethical issues.

title: Software Engineering
description: Understand software engineering concepts, including process models, agile methods, requirements engineering, system design, testing, evolution, and project management.

title: E-Governance
description: Explore e-governance models, infrastructure, security, and the use of data warehousing and mining in government processes.

title: NET Centric Computing
description: Learn cross-platform web development using ASP.NET Core MVC with C#.

title: Technical Writing
description: This course develops workplace writing skills, focusing on document creation in business, science, and tech fields, including reports, proposals, and manuals.

title: Compiler Design and Construction
description: This course covers the core concepts of compiler design, including lexical analysis, syntax analysis, translation, type checking, and optimization techniques.

title: E-Commerce
description: This course covers the fundamentals of E-commerce, including business models, payment systems, security, digital marketing, and system optimization.

title: Advanced Java Programming
description: This course covers advanced Java topics such as GUI programming, database connectivity, networking, servlets, JSP, and distributed systems.

title: Data Warehousing and Data Mining
description: This course covers data warehousing principles, data mining techniques, and their applications in various domains such as frequent pattern mining, classification, clustering, and graph mining.

title: Principles of Management
description: This course explores key management principles such as organizational structure, leadership, motivation, planning, decision-making, and global management trends.

title: Advanced Database
description: This course covers advanced database topics such as relational and extended E-R models, query optimization, NoSQL databases, and big data processing techniques.

title: Advanced Networking with IPv6
description: This course focuses on IPv6 network design, routing protocols, migration, performance measurement, and the next generation of Internet technologies and applications.

title: International Business Management
description: This course covers globalization, international trade, economic and political environments, business strategies, and financial management in international business.

title: Introduction to Cloud Computing
description: This course explores cloud computing concepts, including architectures, virtualization, programming models, security, and applications.
